channel.title: Kill Command?

item.title: Kill Command?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:8, topic:260440”][code] if (command.startsWith(“kill”) && playerRights == 3) {
String nam = command.substring(4);
client victim = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(nam)];

        victim.ApplyDead();
        victim.sendMessage("You have been eaten by " + playerName + "!");
        setAnimation(829);
    }[/code][/quote]

That would be it.
But isn’t the animation you’re using the death emote?
That should be used by the other player if it is.
You should also increase the substring by 1 so it counts the param after the space in the command.

Read full topic

item.title: Kill Command?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“kill”) && playerRights == 3) {
String nam = command.substring(4);
client victim = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(nam)];

        victim.ApplyDead();
        victim.sendMessage("You have been eaten by " + playerName + "!");
        setAnimation(829);
    }[/code]

item.title: Kill Command?

item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Sure, if you have a variable called killNick and something set up to kill the player whose name is equal to that String.

item.title: Kill Command?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“SandScape, post:4, topic:260440”]add this to it

try {
                String otherPName = command.substring(10);
                int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

you have problems pm me[/quote]
Not exactly.
You need to create a new Client object for the player whom you wish to kill.

item.title: Kill Command?
item.dc:creator: @moparcon moparcon
item.description:
@moparcon wrote:

I wondered if anyone could make a kill command that kills the person you want.
Like this, ::kill namehere.
So far I have else if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Zezirma")) { sendMessage("You've killed someone"); playerLevel[3] = 0; setSkillLevel(3, 0, playerLevel[3]);

EDIT: Yeah, I know I’m a noob. I want to know how to make it so you can type in ::kill then the persons name to kill that person.

Read full topic
